bibl.title: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, November 7, 1922

div1.p: Rose sends Carter a copy of Lombard's report on a possible case of yellow fever involving the death of a Spanish seaman and asks for his opinion of the case.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, November 7, 1922

November 7, 1922
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
We have your letter of November 4 and are
glad to have your comments on the yellow fever situa-
tion. We wrote you yesterday that Doctor White desires
your judgment about the case diagnosed as yellow fever
on the “William E. Burnham.”

We are enclosing a copy of the letter re-
ceived from Doctor Lombard, Surgeon in Charge of the
United States Public Health Service station, giving
his description of the symptoms. There has not yet
been time to receive any information from Doctor
Hausheer, the Board's representative at Paramaribo,
whom we have asked to make a thorough investigation
of the situation in Dutch Guiana.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor H. R. Carter
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
